model

Class Deck

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Deck

  • public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains functionality for a deck of Card Objects. It takes an int as an instance variable, which indicates how many of decks of cards the deck contains. It can be instantiated with cards, or as an empty deck, by setting the boolean "emptyDeck" in the constructor to True.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Deck(int number)
      Constructor variable is an integer indicating number of decks of cards to be contained in deck.
      Deck(int number, boolean emptyDeck)
      If constructor variable emptyDeck is set to true, no cards are initially added to deck.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCard(Card c)
      Adds a new Card object to the deck
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object d)
      Verifies if two decks are equal, meaning they have cards with the same values, in the same order.
      Card getLastCard()
      Returns the second last turned card, if it has been set, or returns null.
      int getNumberOfCards() 
      Card getTopCard()
      Returns the last turned card, if it has been set, or returns null.
      java.lang.Boolean isSnap()
      Verifies if the last two turned cards match and snap is valid.
      Card popTopCard()
      Pops the top card from the deck and returns it.
      void setLastCard(Card c)
      Sets the second last turned card.
      void setTopCard(Card c)
      Sets the last turned card
      void shuffle()
      Shuffles the order of cards in deck randomly.
      java.util.ArrayList<Deck> splitDeck(int n)
      This splits the current deck into n equal parts.

      • addCard

        Adds a new Card object to the deck
        Parameters:
        c - Card Object c

      • popTopCard

        public Card popTopCard()
        Pops the top card from the deck and returns it. In this case the top card is considered to be the oldest card.
        Returns:
        Card object

      • splitDeck

        public java.util.ArrayList<Deck> splitDeck(int n)
        This splits the current deck into n equal parts. If there is an uneven amount of cards, they are dealt sequentially, as would occur in a real card game, meaning the last player receive one lest card. N is an int between 2 and 4(inclusive).
        Parameters:
        n - int number of decks
        Returns:
        ArrayList returns an ArrayList of Deck objects

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object d)
        Verifies if two decks are equal, meaning they have cards with the same values, in the same order.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
